subject: p16853729
Findings: There are low lung volumes. The heart size remains moderately enlarged. The aorta is tortuous but stable. There is mild pulmonary vascular congestion with perihilar haziness. More focal opacities in the lung bases may reflect atelectasis, though infection in these regions cannot be completely excluded. Small left pleural effusion appears similar compared to the prior study. No pneumothorax is identified. Mild loss of height anteriorly of an upper lumbar vertebral body is unchanged.
Impression: Mild pulmonary vascular congestion and small left pleural effusion. More focal opacities in the lung bases may reflect atelectasis, though infection in these regions cannot be completely excluded.
